name: Ketamine-Assisted Psychotherapy
summary: A combined approach where ketamine administration is integrated with structured psychotherapy sessions to enhance therapeutic outcomes, particularly for mood disorders, PTSD, and existential distress.
description: Ketamine-Assisted Psychotherapy (KAP) merges the rapid neurobiological effects of ketamine with psychotherapeutic processing. The ketamine is typically given in low to moderate doses via oral, intranasal, or intramuscular routes, creating an altered state of consciousness that can facilitate emotional openness and neuroplasticity. Therapists then guide the patient through preparation, in-session support, and post-session integration to address core psychological patterns, trauma, and existential concerns. This differs from standard IV ketamine infusions by placing equal emphasis on the psychotherapeutic frame.

clinical_metadata.safety_profile: Generally well-tolerated in controlled settings. Dissociation, mild perceptual changes, and transient increases in blood pressure are common during dosing sessions.
clinical_metadata.evidence_level: Moderate for depression and PTSD; emerging for end-of-life anxiety.
clinical_metadata.research_support: Open-label trials and qualitative studies suggest benefit; more large-scale randomized trials are underway.

sections.text: Ketamine’s NMDA receptor antagonism enhances glutamatergic signaling and synaptic plasticity. When paired with psychotherapy, this state can facilitate emotional processing, trauma resolution, and the integration of new cognitive and behavioral patterns.

sections.preparation: Pre-treatment screening, consent, and at least one preparatory psychotherapy session.
procedure: Administer ketamine in a comfortable, supportive environment.
Therapist provides non-directive support during altered state.
sections.frequency: Often 1–2 sessions per week for an initial series of 4–6; maintenance sessions scheduled as needed.
sections.duration: Full course can last 4–8 weeks; integration work may continue beyond pharmacologic phase.
sections.total_treatment_time: Each visit may last 2–3 hours including preparation and integration.

special_considerations: Assess for readiness to engage in deep psychotherapeutic work.

ideal_candidates: Patients with depression not responsive to standard treatments
Individuals with PTSD open to processing trauma
End-of-life patients seeking relief from existential distress

studies: Dore J, et al. Ketamine Assisted Psychotherapy (KAP): Patient demographics, clinical data, and outcomes in three large practices administering ketamine with psychotherapy. J Psychoactive Drugs. 2019.
Wolfson P, et al. Ketamine Assisted Psychotherapy for depression and anxiety: A pilot study. J Psychoactive Drugs. 2020.
sections.limitations: Evidence base is smaller than for IV ketamine alone; protocols vary widely between providers.

sections.typical_session_cost: $400–$1,200 depending on setting and dose route
sections.insurance_coverage: Often not covered unless ketamine is given for pain indications.
sections.cost_effectiveness: Can be high when sustained remission is achieved, reducing hospitalization or chronic therapy needs.

sections.elderly: Cautious dosing and cardiovascular monitoring recommended.
sections.comorbidities: Consider medical clearance in patients with unstable medical conditions.
